Uses of Interface
moxie.ObjectExpectation

  • Packages that use ObjectExpectation 
    Package Description
    moxie
    Moxie: a wicked good Java mocking library.

    • Uses of ObjectExpectation in moxie

      Methods in moxie that return ObjectExpectation 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ObjectExpectation<T> ObjectExpectation.andCallOriginal()
      When a call fulfilling this expectation is received, pass control to the original implementation of the method on the concrete class being mocked.
      ObjectExpectation<T> ObjectExpectation.andVerifyReturn(Object result)
      On a spy object, when a call otherwise fulfilling this expectation is received, delegate to the object being spied upon, then only fulfill this expectation if the value returned matches the given parameter.
      ObjectExpectation<T> ObjectExpectation.andVerifyThrow(Throwable throwable)
      On a spy object, when a call otherwise fulfilling this expectation is received, delegate to the object being spied upon, then only fulfill this expectation if an exception is thrown matching the given parameter.
      <T> ObjectExpectation<T> MoxieControl.expect(T mockObject)
      Domain-specific language method - starts a clause in which an expectation is set on a mock.
      static <T> ObjectExpectation<T> Moxie.expect(T mockObject)
      Domain-specific language method - starts a clause in which an expectation is set on a mock.
      <T> ObjectExpectation<T> MoxieControl.stub(T mockObject)
      Domain-specific language method - starts a clause in which an stub expectation is set on a mock.
      static <T> ObjectExpectation<T> Moxie.stub(T mockObject)
      Domain-specific language method - starts a clause in which an stub expectation is set on a mock.
      ObjectExpectation<T> ObjectExpectation.willCallOriginal()
      When a call fulfilling this expectation is received, pass control to the original implementation of the method on the concrete class being mocked.
      ObjectExpectation<T> ObjectExpectation.willReturnVerified(Object result)
      On a spy object, when a call otherwise fulfilling this expectation is received, delegate to the object being spied upon, then only fulfill this expectation if the value returned matches the given parameter.
      ObjectExpectation<T> ObjectExpectation.willThrowVerified(Throwable throwable)
      On a spy object, when a call otherwise fulfilling this expectation is received, delegate to the object being spied upon, then only fulfill this expectation if an exception is thrown matching the given parameter.
